page.title: 16FARMING IN BURTON (2)
page.content: At Brompton Park{Beef Cattle}are reared and they have{100 calves}and 200{Hereford Cross Friesians.}They keep sheep and at present have 200 ewes for breeding, mostly{Speckled {Face}and{Welsh Halfbred;}these are mated with a Suffolk Ram. The only hay made is for calves in the first three or four weeks of life. Silage is the main{grass crop. The farm is worked by the owner and his son; and they employ three men. The farmer said that since the war the farm has changed from being a dairy farm, with a few{potatoes}and some{oats,}to its present form. He believes that in the future the production of{food crops, red meat}and {milk}will be reduced.
